author: passthenachos
title: Charity Funding SPO
description: 恵まれない子どもたちは、金融教育プログラムを受けることができません。子供に資金を与えるには、親の承認と管理が必要です。

f6_assessments.q0: I have a look at the problem report you mentioned. It's a pity that you haven't given any information about the project. The problem you have raised is quite good but the team has not released any summary yet. solution for this problem. i can only look forward to you next time.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposed team did not provide any information to support your claim of experience. At the same time, the content of this project has not been completed in any way. Hope you can complete it soon and see you on the next day. next quarter.
f6_assessments.q2: this proposal does not provide any information on how to solve it. this is an incomplete proposal, hopefully the team will finalize it soon and we can meet next quarter.

f6_assessments.q0:
"I'm teacher. Therefore, I understand how important education is for children's development. It is pointless to give someone money to charity without teaching them about financial management. Even if we don't give those kids money, but we educate them about finance, they can earn their own money. I really like this idea.
But all that is included in this proposal is just an idea, not a specific solution or plan for implementation"

"The founding team holds over 20 US patents, 2 Technical Emmys, 1 Oscar, Multiple exits, existing web 2.0 Series B funds with A list clients. This is a huge amount of experience for the team. But I still don't know how many people on the team? What are each person's experience and achievements?

f6_assessments.q0: The problem is not within the challenge. And there is no detailed plan or key metrics or KPIs inside the proposal to assess how this proposal impact Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is no implementation plan and detailed explanations about what they want to do. Even have no idea so I cannot give any advice for the detailed plan they would have. 
But for assessing the feasibility of the proposal, the team should have a roadmap with a realistic timeline that they can adapt with their team. The budget should fit with the plan and be reasonable. 
Moreover, showing some relevant risks will help us assess that the team has a well-preparation.
f6_assessments.q2:
As I recommend in 2 previous comments, they should provide those infos. Including roadmap and key metrics, lacking these both can't help to audit. 
Moreover, Catalyst community wants to know how you can acknowledge the problem, and clarify the way you solve that problem. Hence, that is one of the basic info the team must-have in the proposal, too.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal has a problem that within the challenge but has nothing in detail. It doesn't have info about how it will impact on Cardano ecosystem. 
It also doesn't have any key metrics or plans to measure whether what this idea brings is meet the challenge or not.
f6_assessments.q1:
This proposal lack all basic info for assessing the feasibility. The short brief is not enough for assessing. They should inclcude: 
- Detailed implementation plan for knowing what they will do with their solution to address the problem. Not just about the features, but also includes use cases, technology explanation, marketing, activities... the more detail is great
- Detailed roadmap and budget to assess that are they reasonable with plan or not 
- Team info to clarify the ability to execute the plan 
- Relevant risk to know that the team experiencing and well-preparing for the idea.
f6_assessments.q2:
Cannot scoring the auditability of this proposal because it lacks everything for that. For auditing the progress and success of the proposal, it must have: 
- A roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement. And metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal. Those 2 will help Catalyst track and audit in periods. 
- Clear understandable description of the targeted problem. And the clear understandable solution that addresses the problem. These 2 will help to know what is this proposal expects up front. 
This proposal have none of them.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is about SPO for direct funding of children through financial education lessons and donations. The problem statement [Underprivileged children lack access to financial education programs] is quite convincing but not explained in detail. It seems that this proposal is incomplete, without any detail provided. As a result, the solution remains very abstract, however, I think this idea is worth trying for completing in the following fund. Based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's impact, and would give it a score of 2.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposer's profile is briefly described, and shows impressive experiences [with over 20 US patents, 2 Technical Emmys, 1 Oscar, Multiple exits, existing web 2.0 Series B funded with A list clients], however, there is no proof/link for verification. As a result, definitely, there are no grounds to agree on the feasibility of this proposal, however, my only advice would be: in case it is necessary to complete this proposal in the next Catalysts in the future, the proposer should pay attention to ensure that the following components are fully met: (i) Goals and target; (2) road map (integrated with measurable KPIs/metrics); (3) Budget breakdown; (4) Risk and challenge. Based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's feasible, and would give it a score of 2.
f6_assessments.q2: Since this is an incomplete proposal, transparency can't be guaranteed. Therefore, based on the given information, I strongly disagree with this proposal's auditability, and would give it a score of 1.

solution: 金融教育の授業や寄付を通じて子どもたちに直接資金を提供するSPO教育と連動した子ども口座の資金調達方法の構築
experience: 創業者チームは、20件以上の米国特許、2つのテクニカルエミー賞、1つのオスカー賞を受賞しており、複数の出口を持ち、既存のWeb 2.0シリーズB資金を獲得して、Aリストの顧客を抱えています。
